titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of four sets of seemingly unrelated card files. The first set appears to pertain to military service. The cards include names, information about the person, and indication of military service, including during the Revolution or War of 1812. The information may have been compiled from a single source. The second set may have come from someone working on a particular genealogy or interested in a particular Pennsylvania region. Cards include names and some additional information, as well as an indication of the source of the information. The third set includes brief information on various families, many from New Jersey. It also include a set of cards on Rhode Island graveyards. The last set appears to be either client files of a professional genealogist or file related to the compilation of a particular genealogy. Cards include a person's name and address, indications of transactions with the person, family names listed with numerical codes, and occasional information on the person or family.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
